channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: TBC land between 18 and 20 Bramble Chase, 8th December
item.description:
Huge willow tree depositing large amounts of leaves, twigs and branches on pavements and road. Trip and slip hazard and getting caught in pram and car wheels. Willow scheduled for pollarding since last year but no date for the works.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Bramble Chase, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 8th December
item.description:
Tree branches blown down - heavy with mistletoe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path both sides of the road covered in leaves, 8th December
item.description:
Leaves causing problems for pedestrians both sides of the road. Causing a slip risk
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 8th December
item.description:
Cllr says that tree that was apparently made safe on emergency OOH 70000094 is "still where it fell, part way though fence of 107 Carter Road. Annoyingly, it's one that I have mentioned several times previously, as it did appear to be mostly dead and now the roots are exposed, we can see why."
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 8th December
item.description:
Work by M J Quinn for openreach was taking place across the drive of 4a 4b and 4c Kent Close Churchdown GL3 2HQ barriers were erected preventing access no warning were given and the notice of closure gave no permit number. The phone number given which I rang rudely referred me to the local authority ie GCC phone calls to your office are not accepted and this is the second time I have filled in this form due to your technical issues. It is not acceptable to wake to find access to three houses is denied without prior warning please get your act together an apology would not go amiss.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised ironwork on Thirlestain Road, 8th December
item.description:
Raise ironwork posing hazard to cyclists, in Thirlestaine Road outside the exist to Cheltenham College swimming pool / sports facilities. This is a small iron cover (for access to fire hydrant?) which has partially collapsed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bath Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole, 8th December
item.description:
On Parton Road travelling in the direction of Gloucester (3 houses down on the left )from the mini roundabout. Resident is concerned for the school bicycle users safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes over brow of Hill leaving Leckhampton, 8th December
item.description:
Multiple Potholes making it very difficult to avoid with oncoming traffic. Potholes getting worse over the past few months despite what appears to be some repairs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large hot hole at the edge of the road, 8th December
item.description:
Leaving Leckhampton shortly before the traffic calming measures. Been there for weeks and getting worse. Scary choice drive-through pothole or cross Central white line to avoid.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 8th December
item.description:
Customer reporting gully is blocked with leaves/silt - causes surface water to flow down Post Office Lane
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 8th December
item.description:
Just by the hump of the bridge. Really big and easy to miss especially given the flooding.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light island one of the kerb edging stones dislodged, 8th December
item.description:
On the small island where the traffic light sits the kerb edging has become dislodged. Dangerous for pedestrians who may trip/lose footing. What 3 words: ///spine.space.rugs
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 71, Christchurch Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 8th December

Remove fallen tree off footpath and verge (Damaged Tree)

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 8th December
item.description:
Customer reporting blocked drainage chamber at location - causes drainage system to back up in the area and raises manhole covers when it rains. (related to 70000239)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox needs removing, 8th December
item.description:
Dead fox to be removed please. End of driveway towards footpath 122 lavington drive

item.title: Pavement damaged / missing, 8th December
item.description:
Outside South Winds - the pavement has been so badly erroded (because of no kerb) that you cannot fit a pram or wheelchair/ on it without going into the road. You can see a one year old tarmac "cow pat" repair which has already sunken into the ground. This pavements needs restoring and a kerb putting in place to protect it from damage from vehicles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battledown Approach, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Disgusting overflowing dog waste bins, 8th December
item.description:
Multiple dog waste bins in areas havent been emptied for what looks like weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goldsmith Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
